title: X, ChatGPT down: Big glitch hits Cloudflare; 100s of websites affected - check list
content: A widespread internet disruption is affecting popular platforms like X and ChatGPT due to issues with Cloudflare, a major content delivery network provider. Users are encountering error messages and are unable to access various websites and online services. The problems began this morning and are directly linked to Cloudflare's system malfunctions.

title: Apple designer Abidur Chowdhury quits: Why man behind Apple’s thinnest iPhone left
content: Apple's iPhone Air designer, Abidur Chowdhury, has exited the tech giant for an AI startup, adding to a wave of departures from the company's design division.  His exit, despite his prominent role, is reportedly unrelated to the iPhone Air's sales performance, which has been below expectations.  This move occurs as Apple's design leadership undergoes significant restructuring, with teams now reporting directly to CEO Tim Cook, signaling a new era for the company's famed aesthetic.

title: Guwahati Test - Proteas add Lungi Ngidi as cover for Kagiso Rabada
content: South Africa bolsters their pace attack for the second Test against India with the inclusion of Lungi Ngidi, replacing the injured Kagiso Rabada. Ngidi's return comes after a strong performance in the first Test where South Africa secured a historic victory. India now faces the challenge of leveling the series in Guwahati.

title: 'Attack on RJD’s soul': Tej Pratap flags ‘pressure’ on Lalu, Rabri; makes plea to PM Modi, Shah
content: Tej Pratap Yadav has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to investigate alleged mental and physical pressure on his parents, Lalu Prasad and Rabri Devi. He called it an attack on the RJD's soul, naming individuals he claims harassed his sister Rohini Acharya.

title: What is Cloudflare: Here's why it has brought down most of your internet
content: A massive technical failure at Cloudflare, a critical internet infrastructure provider, caused widespread outages for major platforms including OpenAI, Twitter (X), and Spotify. The incident, which began around 12:00 UTC on November 18, impacted services that rely on Cloudflare's CDN, DDoS protection, and DNS services. Cloudflare has confirmed the disruption and is actively working to restore services.

title: 'Complicated': Trump official on India-US trade deal; what's holding up pact?
content: India-US trade deal: A senior Trump administration official indicated a trade deal between India and the US is nearing finalization, though complexities arise from India's dealings with Russia. Discussions have been ongoing since March, with both sides expressing optimism for a fair and balanced agreement that protects Indian communities.

title: US jobs & AI: Trump adviser blames AI-led efficiency for labour market 'quiet time'
content: A senior Trump administration economic adviser suggested AI could boost worker productivity, potentially reducing the need for new hires. While acknowledging mixed job market signals, he highlighted strong output growth, attributing it to AI-driven efficiency. However, he predicted this cooling effect on hiring would be temporary as market forces adjust.

title: Explained: Why Warren Buffett’s Berkshire is betting on Google-parent Alphabet?
content: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has made a significant multibillion-dollar investment in Alphabet, Google's parent company, marking a rare move into fast-growing tech. This substantial stake, now among Berkshire's top ten holdings, highlights Alphabet's strong cash flows, dominant market position, and appealing valuation, even as Berkshire trims other investments and holds record cash.

title: Spotify down: Spotify app users report issues on DownDetector
content: Millions of Spotify users experienced widespread disruptions and service malfunctions on November 18, with issues impacting app functionality, streaming, and web players.  These widespread problems were reportedly caused by an outage affecting the content delivery network provider, Cloudflare, which also impacted other major websites.

title: 'Sinister design': Congress attacks EC over SIR; to hold rally in December
content: In a recent AICC meet, Rahul Gandhi has expressed deep apprehension regarding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, fearing it may unjustly disenfranchise genuine voters. He called upon Congress to tackle this issue from political, organizational, and legal fronts.

title: Sophie Cunningham disses Caitlin Clark: Never trust her with my social media
content: Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham humorously declared teammate Caitlin Clark would be her last choice to manage her social media, calling her a "shit starter." This lighthearted jab highlights their strong off-court bond as both players recover from season-ending injuries. Cunningham has consistently defended Clark's significant impact on the WNBA's popularity.

title: UK MPs in China's crosshairs: MI5 issues spy alert; how they are being targetted
content: British intelligence agency MI5 has issued an "espionage alert" to UK MPs and peers, warning that China is attempting to recruit parliamentarians. Individuals linked to China's ministry of state security are reportedly using professional networking sites and recruitment agents to establish long-term relationships and gather information.

title: Meet Thomas Massie: The Republican who is openly defying Trump
content: He is not Liz Cheney, who converted resistance to Trump into a full-time vocation. He is not Mitt Romney, who gave a valedictory speech and left Washington shaking his head. Massie is something more awkward and therefore more interesting: a Republican who will accept Trump’s endorsement and still publicly defy him; a man who will pose for a Christmas card with his family holding assault rifles and then, in the next breath, launch a bureaucratic insurgency to force the president into a corner on one of the darkest scandals of the age.

title: Delhi blast: Cong MP's 'misguided' remark sparks fury; BJP calls him 'spin doctor'
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticized Congress MP Imran Masood for calling suicide bomber Umar Un Nabi a "misguided youth." Poonawalla accused the Congress of prioritizing vote bank politics over national interest, citing past instances where opposition leaders allegedly downplayed terror acts. The remarks came after a video emerged of the bomber justifying his actions.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Houston Astros hit with Jose Altuve health news ahead of spring training
content: Jose Altuve, the face of the Houston Astros' recent dominance, underwent a minor foot procedure early in the offseason. Despite a dip in production and defensive questions, Altuve is expected to be ready for Spring Training, leaving the Astros with limited internal options at second base as they shape their 2026 roster.

title: Death penalty for Hasina: Dhaka wants her back; can India refuse extradition?
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was sentenced to death in absentia for the 2024 student crackdown, a verdict she called a foregone conclusion. India responded cautiously, acknowledging the verdict and reiterating its commitment to Bangladesh's peace and stability, while remaining non-committal on extradition requests.

title: Babar Azam slapped with heavy fine; ICC punish batter for code of conduct breach
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam faced a penalty from the ICC, receiving a 10% match fee fine for a Code of Conduct breach.  The incident involved him striking the stumps with his bat after being dismissed in the third ODI against Sri Lanka. This marks his first offense in two years, resulting in a demerit point.

title: Laid-off employee in her 40s shares 5 ways mid-career professionals can bounce back
content: Mid-career professionals in their 40s are facing increasing layoffs, impacting their identity and confidence. Laura Zimmermaker's experience highlights the importance of reclaiming professional identity, rebuilding narratives with intention, and learning to articulate one's story with confidence. Treating rejection as information and building alternative paths can lead to reinvention and autonomy.

title: 'No whitewashing!' India roars at SCO; demands 'zero tolerance' on terror
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar urged the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) to adopt a "zero tolerance" approach to terrorism, emphasizing its founding purpose. Speaking in Moscow, he also called for reforms in the organization's working methods to adapt to the evolving global landscape. Jaishankar highlighted India's right to defend its people against terrorism.

title: Delhi 2020 riots 'attack on sovereignty': Cops oppose Umar Khalid's bail in SC
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2020 Delhi riots were a pre-planned attempt to divide society communally, not a spontaneous protest. He argued accused activists are responsible for trial delays. Meanwhile, the Delhi high court directed police to update on riot investigations, noting petitions have been pending for six years without pursuing alternate legal remedies.

title: Pitch in focus - After Eden Gardens' criticism, Guwahati may offer turn and bounce at pace
content: Guwahati's Barsapara Stadium is gearing up for an exciting Test match, with its red soil pitch poised to provide superb bounce and carry. The Indian team management is advocating for spin-friendly conditions against South Africa, and the expertise of BCCI head curator Ashish Bhowmick promises a pitch that delivers.

title: 5 common medicines that can damage kidneys and what are the alternatives
content: Millions in India face chronic kidney disease, with drug-induced damage a significant concern. Common medications like NSAIDs, antibiotics, and contrast agents can harm kidneys, especially with long-term use or in vulnerable individuals. Understanding these risks and consulting doctors is crucial for prevention.

title: Ashes down under: First since 1982 - Why Gabba will not host first Test of series?
content: The Ashes series opener moves from Brisbane's Gabba for the first time since 1982, with Perth Stadium hosting the first Test. This shift, driven by commercial decisions and scheduling, marks a departure from the Gabba's historical dominance, especially against England. The series will then proceed to Brisbane for a day-night Test.

title: What US numbers and India’s rise tell us about American dream
content: Open Doors 2025 shows a sharp shift in US international education. Total international students hit 1.17 million, but new arrivals are down and enrolled classroom numbers are flat. Growth is now driven by OPT and post-study work, not fresh enrolment. India leads this transition as the top sender, powering STEM, OPT and the new version of the American dream.

title: 'Shouted at stupid people': Trump says trade talks with 'a country' left his voice hoarse
content: President Trump explained his hoarse voice stemmed from arguing with individuals he deemed "stupid" about trade and tariff policies. He admitted to "blowing his stack" during discussions with an unnamed country attempting to renegotiate a trade deal, a move that has become a central point of his economic agenda amidst a Supreme Court review of his emergency powers.

title: Who Is Girlalala? TikTok star shot as boyfriend Shanoyd Whyte is arrested
content: Popular TikToker Girlalala, real name Maurice Jaden Harrison, has died. She was shot inside her apartment. Her boyfriend, Shanoyd Whyte, has been arrested and charged with murder. The couple had a history of domestic issues documented online. This tragic event has sparked reactions from fans and celebrities, highlighting the dangers of domestic violence.

title: Hasina death sentence fallout? BCCI postpones India-Bangladesh women's series
content: India's women's cricket series against Bangladesh, slated for next month, has been postponed by the BCCI. The board is actively seeking an alternative opponent for December. This development follows diplomatic tensions between the two nations, though not officially confirmed as the reason for the postponement. The team awaits a new schedule before the WPL and a subsequent tour of Australia.

title: 'You'll hear good news ...': Goyal on India-US trade deal; what's in focus
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal indicated that a trade pact between India and the US is nearing completion, emphasizing the need for a fair, equitable, and balanced agreement. He assured that India will continue to protect the interests of its farmers, fishermen, and small industries during ongoing negotiations.

title: Chop, change and crumble: How Gambhir’s Test tactics are hurting India at home
content: While he has been spot-on in limited-overs formats, the head coach's red-ball stint has been marked by a stubborn preference for underprepared tracks, which have put India's batters at a disadvantage. The constant chopping & changing also seems to have led to declining results.

title: 'I will retire if ... ': Prashant Kishor changes stance on vow to quit politics
content: Jan Suraaj supremo Prashant Kishor accepted full responsibility for his party's complete failure in the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, admitting he could not earn voters' trust. Despite contesting 238 seats, Jan Suraaj won none, with Kishor vowing to intensify his work in Bihar and observe a silent fast as atonement.

title: Assam comes together to remember Zubeen Garg on his 53rd birth anniversary
content: Assam embraced a wave of nostalgia and tribute as it marked Zubeen Garg's 53rd birth anniversary, the first since his departure. Fans passionately celebrated by congregating at his residence for heartwarming midnight cake cutting sessions and singing his iconic tracks.

title: 'Even Sachin, Virat won't survive here': Harbhajan tears into Eden pitch
content: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh came down heavily on the pitch curator during his YouTube show, expressing concerns over the direction in which Test cricket is heading in the country. India suffered a 30-run defeat in the first Test against South Africa at the Eden Garden in Kolkata, exposing their struggles against quality spin.  Chasing a modest target of 124, the Indian batting lineup folded for just 93 runs.

title: Saudi bus accident: 3 generations wiped out as 18 from one family killed
content: A family's joy turned to tragedy when 18 members of the Shaik family perished in a bus fire in Saudi Arabia while en route to Medina. The family, who lived in a bustling home in Hyderabad's Vidyanagar, were on a pilgrimage. Only one immediate family member, living in the US, survives this devastating loss.

title: H-1B visa holders are not ‘cheap labour’ - why foreign workers are important for US
content: A National Foundation for American Policy report argues that H-1B visa restrictions, including a new $100,000 fee, are counterproductive. The report highlights that H-1B holders are highly skilled professionals earning substantial salaries, not cheap labor, and that limiting these visas could drive jobs and innovation abroad.

title: Treat wars! Reliance set to disrupt pet food market with ‘Waggies’
content: Reliance Consumer Products is set to disrupt India's booming pet food sector with its new brand, Waggies. Employing an aggressive pricing strategy, Waggies will be priced 20-50% lower than established brands, targeting mass-market consumers and general trade outlets.

title: SC: Tetra packs of whisky dangerous, why allow them?
content: The Supreme Court expressed concern over states permitting liquor sales in small tetra packs, likening them to juice containers and highlighting potential risks to children. This issue emerged during a trademark dispute between whisky producers Allied Blenders and John Distillers, where tetra packs constitute a significant portion of sales in some regions.

title: PhysicsWallah IPO: Shares list with strong gains; should buy, sell or hold?
content: PhysicsWallah debuted strongly on the stock market, with shares rising significantly above its IPO price. This surge reflects investor confidence in the edtech firm's brand and hybrid model, though analysts suggest caution due to competition and profitability concerns. The IPO, one of the largest in India's edtech sector, was driven by institutional investors.

title: 'I'll do it again': Pakistani rapper drapes himself in Indian flag- watch video
content: Pakistani rapper Talha Anjum caused a stir by waving the Indian flag during a concert in Nepal.  He later defended his actions, stating his art has no borders and he does not care about propaganda.  While some Pakistanis criticised the move, many Indians praised the gesture. The incident has generated significant social media discussion.

title: Week 12 NFL Power Rankings: Bengals and Vikings drop, plus who is under the most pressure on each team
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 12. Plus, who is under the most pressure for each team over the rest of the 2025 season?

title: Source: Draymond warned for engaging vocal fan
content: The NBA has issued a warning -- but no fine -- to Golden State's Draymond Green following his interaction with a vocal fan in New Orleans, a source told ESPN.

title: Giants' Carter: Missed practice 'honest mistake'
content: Giants rookie Abdul Carter denies sleeping through a recent practice, saying a change in the team's original practice schedule led to an "honest mistake."

title: Va. Tech hires Franklin; PSU buyout renegotiated
content: Virginia Tech hired James Franklin to be its next football coach. The former Penn State coach was originally owed a $49 million buyout after being fired, but part of his deal with the Hokies includes a $9 million settlement from PSU, sources told ESPN.

title: Man charged with murder in shooting of Beam
content: A 27-year-old man was charged Monday with murder in the death of celebrated former football coach John Beam.

title: Ovechkin passes Howe in goals at single venue
content: Alex Ovechkin passed Gordie Howe for the most regular-season goals scored at a single venue in NHL history with his 442nd goal at Capital One Arena.

title: Skaggs' mom: Angels never asked about addiction
content: Debbie Hetman, the mother of Tyler Skaggs, said she didn't know whether her son informed the Angels of his drug addiction but added that she was never asked.

title: Alcaraz to miss Davis Cup finals due to injury
content: Top-ranked Carlos Alcaraz will not play for Spain in the Davis Cup finals against the Czech Republic in Italy because of an injured right hamstring.

title: Source: Sanders' home broken into during debut
content: There was a break-in at the home of Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders during Sunday's game against the Ravens, a source confirmed to ESPN on Monday.

title: Woo's debut 2026 mock draft: Where Peterson, Dybantsa, Boozer could land
content: Early injuries scattering the No. 1 pick race? Only two guards in the top 10? Let's project all 30 picks for the 2026 first round.

title: Is the salary cap a problem? Are teams still breaking rules?
content: ESPN's NWSL GM survey returns as execs dish on the worst front offices, tensions with USWNT, breaking the rules, their player wish list and more.

title: 'We've proven you can win this way': Why Duke is running it back with freshmen﻿
content: Can Duke's freshman class live up to last season's success? Jon Scheyer thinks Cameron Boozer & Co. can do it.

title: Men's Bracketology: Arizona sees big boost, plus a new No. 1 overall seed
content: The Wildcats are stacking Quad 1 wins while teams on the top line shuffle in latest NCAA tournament projections.

title: Women's Bracketology: How one bad week cost the ACC
content: Last week, ACC teams made up a quarter of the top 16. Now, just UNC and NC State remain as projected hosts.

title: 'He's already unlocked things': Why the Magic needed Desmond Bane
content: Orlando is hoping its all-in approach for Desmond Bane will help stars Paolo Banchero and Franz Wagner win a championship.

title: Fixing the Mavs: Why there's no cure-all for this Dallas disaster
content: Can this mess be fixed? Our NBA insiders are breaking down the Mavs' options amid a tumultuous 4-10 start.

title: Reyna takes advantage of opportunity in return, as USMNT continues unbeaten run
content: Gio Reyna had a chance to redeem himself and make it to the USMNT's World Cup squad next year and he took full advantage in its 2-1 win against Paraguay.

title: 'Cool and new thing for me': Zdeno Chara on entrepreneurship, his new job with the Bruins and more
content: Since retiring from the NHL, Chara hasn't slowed down at all. We caught up with the former Bruins captain, who opened up about his life and goals outside of the rink.

title: Draymond Green reflects on being on receiving end of Wemby alley-oop slam
content: Though the play didn't count, Victor Wembanyama's dunk over Draymond Green on Friday quickly became a viral moment.

title: 'I wouldn't be here without him:' Why Daniel Jones is leaning on a longtime Peyton Manning confidant
content: Jones leaned on David Cutcliffe during his struggles with the Giants and even after losing to Pittsburgh this season.

title: Buzz: Week 11 was a rough one for many superstars
content: Week 11 brought opportunities for top fantasy options, but it also saw many disappointing performances.

title: Cena makes final 'Raw' appearance: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: Cam Skattebo, Abdul Carter and Giants scuffle ringside with Judgement Day at 'Raw'
content: The New York Giants took matters into their own hands -- or fists -- when Judgement Day called them out.

title: 2026 World Cup: Germany, Netherlands book their places
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it's looking around the globe.

title: How Norway sealed first World Cup spot since 1998
content: With the likes of Erling Haaland and Martin Ødegaard, Norway are ready to make an impact on the big stage.

title: Boxing's top 25 under 25: Itauma, Norman, Mason, Fundora, more
content: Boxing's future is in a great place with many young fighters making their mark in the sport. Here's our list.

title: How five-star Austin Goosby fits at Texas, more 2026 commitment projections
content: Breaking down top class of 2026 commitments, including the five-star who stayed in-state to play for Texas.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City, Liverpool, Spurs eye Semenyo release clause
content: Manchester City, Liverpool and Tottenham all hold an interest in signing Bournemouth forward Antoine Semenyo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Think Bengaluru traffic is bad? Try controlling it
content: The Hindu reporter gets an opportunity to man one of Bengaluru’s busiest traffic junctions during the morning peak hour.

title: Coffee Board of India sets a target to double production to over 7 lakh tonnes by 2047
content: Goal is to achieve 15% speciality coffee out of this 7 lakh tons, says Coffee Board Chairman M.J. Dinesh

title: Over 100 minors, held as bonded labourers, rescued from Raipur factory
content: NHRC member says that the children – mostly tribals from Assam, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Odisha – were exposed to formaldehyde, a chemical known to cause cancer

title: NEP in Maharashtra: Panchet’s model cluster school highlights gains—and gaps
content: Maharashtra’s school mergers seek to enhance resources and accessibility, but face criticism over their impact on education equity.

title: EAM Jaishankar calls on Russian President Putin
content: Jaishankar is in Moscow to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Heads of State Council meeting

title: On Bangladesh’s extradition request for Hasina, Delhi has several options
content: No formal extradition request received yet; treaty permits exceptions for “political offences”, “unjust or oppressive charges”; Delhi could allow Ms. Hasina her say during an extradition trial or deny ICT’s validity

title: Raj Bhavan files police complaint against Trinamool MP for arms distributed from Governor House remark
content: The complaint by Raj Bhawan commission of offence under Section 151 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Samhita (BNS) which is non bailable in nature. Governor Bose had indicated that he will take strongest possible action against the  Trinamool MP for the remark that arms were distributed from Raj Bhawan.

title: 24 government hospitals in Andhra Pradesh to have Critical Care Blocks
content: 22 hospitals will have 50 beds, one will have 75 and another will have 100 beds; In every 50-bed CCB, there will be a ten-bed ICU, a six-bed mini ICU, maternity, isolation and casualty wards and beds for dialysis patients

title: ‘Missing candidates’ vexes opposing electoral campaigns
content: Political parties discovering their candidates missing from the voters’ list at the last minute is threatening to upend campaigns in at least two corporations and one municipality.

title: Tharoor praises Modi’s speech on India’s ‘constructive’ impatience for development
content: The Congress MP says the Prime Minister’s appeal for a decade-long mission to restore pride in India’s heritage, languages, and knowledge traditions was a central theme of the speech

title: Anmol Bishnoi, key accused in Baba Siddique murder case, being deported from U.S., police say
content: Mumbai Police had sent two proposals about his extradition, the official said, adding there are multiple cases registered against the gangster across the country, and the Union government will decide to which agency his custody should be given first.

title: Opposition takes a dig at AAP over poor law and order in Punjab
content: Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja Warring said the AAP government had completely abdicated its authority and the criminals and gangsters were killing people with impunity

title: Greater Tirupati to expand from Kalyani dam to IIT campus
content: MCT council approves plans to enlarge city limits, bringing key reservoirs and 10 consenting panchayats into the corporation’s jurisdiction

title: Delhi blast: Government cautions TV channels against airing videos of accused persons justifying violent acts
content: Such broadcasts may inadvertently encourage or incite violence, disrupt public order, and pose risks to national security, it says

title: Devotion, enthusiasm mark ‘Sri Sathya Sai Rathotsavam’ in Puttaparthi
content: Former Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu and a host of dignitaries take part in the first-ever chariot festival; Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan to attend the celebrations on November 19

title: Reconstruction of 498 ancient temples under way with ₹603 crore: Endowments Minister
content: A committee has been formed to ensure government cooperation with private temples so that no difficulties arise during major festivals, says Anam

title: Al Falah University Founder Arrested In Money Laundering Case
content: Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui, the founder of Al Falah University - the epicentre of terror module behind the Delhi blast, was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a terror financing-linked money laundering case on Tuesday.

title: Sheikh Hasina Death Sentence Is Illegal, Unimplementable, Untenable: Sources
content: Serious legal, constitutional, and procedural lapses have raised profound concerns about the validity of the death sentence handed down to ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina by the International Crimes Tribunal-Bangladesh (ICT-B).

title: Kerala Man Arrested For Creating Viral AI-Generated Zipline Accident Video
content: The Wayanad Cyber Police have arrested a 29-year-old man from Kerala's Alappuzha district for creating and circulating an AI-generated video that falsely depicts a zipline accident involving a woman and child.

title: Blueprint Ready For Nitish Kumar Cabinet, Talks Held With Amit Shah: Sources
content: A broad consensus has been reached on the formation of the cabinet of Chief Minister Nitish Kumar in Bihar. The oath ceremony will be held on November 20.

title: Rohini Acharya Slams Tejashwi's Aide Sanjay Yadav, Challenges Him To Donate His Kidney
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) Chief Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, on Tuesday, once again launched a sharp attack on Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Yadav, accusing him of humiliating her despite her sacrifice of donating a kidney to her father.

title: Two Men With Murder History Kill, Bury Engineer In Drishyam-Style Crime
content: In a crime spanning two states, police arrested two repeat offenders on Tuesday while uncovering the murder of an engineer, Srinath, who reportedly went missing from Karnataka's Bengaluru and was found buried inside a house in Andhra Pradesh.

title: J&K Police Bust Attempt To Revive Banned Kashmiri Women Terror Group
content: The J&K Police's Counter-Intelligence Kashmir (CIK) uncovered a major linkage between the terror outfit JeM and the banned women terror group Dukhtaran-e-Millat during raids at multiple locations in the Valley on Tuesday, sources have told NDTV.

title: "Ghost Of Bastar": The Rise And Fall Of Maoist Leader Madvi Hidma
content: A phantom to security forces, a legend among Maoists, and the mastermind behind India's deadliest Naxal attacks, Hidma's story was a mix of brutality, brilliance, and near-mythical survival.

title: Man, 62, With Mental Health Issues Arrested For Bengaluru Metro Bomb Threat
content: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 62-year-old man for sending a bomb threat email to the Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL). The accused, Rajiv, is a diploma holder and lives on Belthur 2nd Main Road, 6th Cross.

title: Bubble Or Breakout? Nvidia Earnings Put AI Boom Under The Microscope
content: The fate of Wall Street's staggering bets on artificial intelligence will rest squarely on Nvidia on Wednesday when the chipmaker reports results, with investors seeking signs that bubble worries are overblown.

title: Delhi Bomber Visited Pulwama Home Week Before Blast, Gave His Phone To Brother
content: In the first confirmation that the video by the Delhi suicide bomber, Dr Umar Mohammad alias Umar-un-Nabi, was shot at least a week before the blast, sources have told NDTV that the clip was on a phone Nabi had given to his brother.

title: Ahead Of PM Modi's Visit, MK Stalin Places 3 Demands For Tamil Nadu Farmers
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's farmers' programme in Coimbatore tomorrow, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin has urged the Centre to urgently support the state's farmers facing heavy distress due to a bumper paddy harvest.

title: You'll Hear Good News Once India-US Trade Deal Is Fair: Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said "you will hear a good news" on the proposed trade pact between India and the US once the deal is fair, equitable and balanced.

title: Charges Framed Against Maharashtra Ex-Minister In Money Laundering Case
content: A special court in Mumbai framed charges against former Maharashtra minister and NCP leader Nawab Malik in a money laundering case linked to activities of fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides after he pleaded not guilty.

title: 'Criminals Are Seen Limping In Jail In New Uttar Pradesh': Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that "New Uttar Pradesh does not accept crime", and if any incident of loot or snatching takes place, the criminal is seen limping in jail within a few hours.

title: "No Looking Away": S Jaishankar On Terrorism At SCO Meet In Russia
content: Underscoring that there can be "no looking away" and "no whitewashing", India called upon the world to display "zero tolerance" towards terrorism in all its forms, days after 15 people were killed in a bomb blast in Delhi.

title: After NDTV Report, Centre Details Plan To Make Makhana Farmers' Lives Easier
content: Bihar produces nearly all of India's foxnut or makhana, the soft kernel of the prickly water lily. And even though it is prized for its nutritional value, with many terming it a superfood, the farmers who produce it face serious challenges.

title: Mahayuti Discord Spills Into Public, But Leaders Insist All Is Well
content: Tensions within the ruling Mahayuti alliance spilt into public view on Tuesday after several Shiv Sena (Shinde faction) ministers skipped the cabinet meeting, prompting talk of a boycott.

title: Ex Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa Summoned In Child Sex Abuse Case
content: In more trouble for former Karnataka chief minister BS Yediyurappa, a special court has summoned him in connection with a child sex abuse case on December 2.

title: Pilot project begins as GBA prepares citywide paid parking plan backed by DULT study
content: As Bengaluru’s streets choke under unregulated parking, the Greater Bengaluru Authority has drawn up a plan to introduce paid parking across all five corporation wards

title: LDF finalises plan for district panchayat in Pathanamthitta
content: Of the 17 seats, CPI(M) will contest in 10, CPI in three, Kerala Congress (M) in two seats while RJD and JD(S) will contest in one seat each

title: PM-KISAN funds row in West Bengal: BJP claims ₹10,500 crore disbursed; TMC cries foul
content: State BJP President Samik Bhattacharya alleges TMC reluctance delayed benefits for 46 lakh farmers; TMC counters, calling the claims “preposterous and baseless”

title: Telangana gearing to unveil ₹1,000-crore Fund of Funds for startups
content: Rollout likely in January, focus to be on AI startups; State also keen on emerging as global AI hub, says IT Secretary Sanjay Kumar

title: CPI demands judicial probe into encounter in Alluri Sitharama Raju district
content: It is unacceptable for a democratically elected government to resort to encounters instead of resolving issues through negotiations, says CPI leader Ramakrishna

title: TTD board firm on unravelling the conspiracy behind the Parakamani scam
content: At a high-level meeting, it has decided to take immediate steps to nullify the ‘collusive Lok Adalat award’ dated September 9, 2023, and file a fresh complaint to unravel more such thefts and misappropriations that may have happened in the past

title: City of Pearls reclaims its crown as Hyderabad Pearls move one step closer to GI tag
content: Hyderabad’s reputation as the “City of Pearls” is rooted in its history under the Qutb Shahi dynasty and the Nizams, who imported natural pearls from the Arabian Gulf, particularly Basra, and developed a thriving pearl-processing industry

title: Hyderabad doctors perform rare lung transplant on 12-year-old boy
content: The procedure was necessitated after the child accidentally consumed paraquat, a highly toxic herbicide, causing irreversible damage to his lungs

title: OCTOPUS and police personnel arrest 51 Maoists in Andhra Pradesh
content: The arrests have been made during search operations conducted in five district, and hunt is on for those who escaped, says Additional Director General of Police (Intelligence) Mahesh Chandra Laddha

title: Heavy rain disrupts normal life in southern Kerala
content: The Kerala State Disaster Management Authority issued an orange alert for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, and Alappuzha districts applicable for the next 24 hours.

title: Kerala University Syndicate members accuse V-C of contempt for High Court, governing bodies
content: Left-backed Syndicate members decry Mohanan Kunnummal’s decision to postpone a Syndicate meeting scheduled for Tuesday

title: Kakani accuses the government of removing seven lakh farmers from the PM KISAN Scheme beneficiary list
content: The former Agriculture Minister alleges failure to disburse ₹21,432 crore in promised aid and points to black-market sale of urea at inflated prices

title: Sivankutty writes to Union Railways Minister, seek compensation, job for Sreekutty
content: The 19-year-old teenager sustained serious injuries after she was kicked off a moving express train by an allegedly inebriated passenger two weeks ago

title: Shifting loyalties continue to shake up Thrissur ahead of local body elections
content: Rebels emerge across parties as denial of seats and internal rifts trigger mass resignations. What began as sporadic rumblings of discontent has now grown into a district-wide wave of political realignments, setting the stage for one of Thrissur’s most unpredictable and fiercely contested local body elections in recent memory

title: Students told to stay away from drug abuse
content: Police teams will visit educational institutes and educate students on the legal, social and health consequences of drug abuse, says Guntur SP

title: Hidma’s killing significant blow to red terror: Chhattisgarh CM
content: Madvi Hidma  was one of the most notorious Maoist commanders active in Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, say police

title: Centre launches ASHA, an AI platform to gather PDS feedback
content: Food Ministry rolls out digital initiatives, including Bhandaran 360 and Anna Darpan, to modernise supply chain

title: New study warns of severe antimicrobial resistance crisis in India
content: AIG Hospitals chairman, who presented the findings, describes the situation as one of the most dangerous public health threats, calls for urgent regulatory and behavioural changes

title: KTR, Harish, other BRS leaders visit cotton procurement centres, demand lifting of curbs
content: BRS stages protests in cotton growing across Telangana demanding relaxation in norms of per acre procurement, moisture content

title: Mandya and Kodagu district administrations discuss measures to control stray dog menace
content: ‘All necessary measures should be taken to curb stray dogs while ensuring animal welfare and the safety of citizens’

title: Karnataka to release first-of-its-kind Child Rights Index
content: The document is meant to act as a quick reference for government officials for the effective implementation of child-related schemes within their respective departments

title: ‘Ayushman Bharat is grappling with outcome gap, yet to deliver tangible value to citizens’
content: Former UIDAI chairperson says average user has generated fewer than one digital health record in three years, even though the national target is five a year

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: Strict rules for election printing
content: Except for handwritten materials, name and address of printer and publisher must be clearly displayed on front page of all election leaflets, posters, and notices

title: Bengaluru citizens protest Supreme Court order on removing street dogs from public institutions
content: Over 250 citizens gathered at Freedom Park to protest the recent Supreme Court order directing the removal of street dogs from public institutions such as schools and hospitals

title: Tekmal sub-inspector held for demanding ₹30,000 in bribe
content: Celebrations broke out in the area following the sub-inspector’s arrest with locals bursting firecrackers

title: Andhra Pradesh to release aid under Annadata Sukhibhava - PM Kisan on November 19
content: A sum of ₹3,135.01 crore to be disbursed under both the schemes, benefiting 46.85 lakh farmers across the State

title: Goddess Padmavati rides ‘Pedda Sesha Vahanam’ at Tiruchanur temple on the second day of Kartheeka Brahmotsavams
content: Despite the continuous rain, cultural troupes perform Kolatam, Chekka Bhajana, and played various musical instruments, leading the procession

title: Delay in implementing Bodo Accord: Assam group to protest in Delhi
content: The All Bodo Students’ Union also wants the Centre to fast-track the 125th Constitution Amendment of Article 280

title: Govt. expedites paddy procurement in Andhra Pradesh
content: It purchases 2,36,284  tonnes from 32,793 farmers so far this season and credits ₹560.48 crore into their bank accounts within 24 hours, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar

title: Paul vs. Joshua: Everything you need to know
content: he will face former heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua in a heavyweight fight Dec. 19 at Kaseya Center in Miami (Netflix) it's a drastic shift in gears after Paul was originally scheduled to face a catchweight of 195 pounds last week . the fight was canceled in the wake of a lawsuit filed by his ex-girlfriend that accused him of battery, aggravated battery, false imprisonment, kidnapping and intentional infliction of emotional distress .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close before the third ranking?
content: the college football playoff field includes 19 power 4 teams still in contention to compete for their respective conference titles . four teams (Alabama, Georgia, Texas A&M and Ole Miss) are still eligible to reach the SEC championship game . there are no locks in the Big 12, where Texas Tech, BYU, Cincinnati and Arizona State are all still alive .

title: Free agent pickups: Believe in Brissett to replace your injured QB?
content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

title: Where college football's top 20 freshmen rank after two months
content: tuesday's vs. byu Cougars looks at our expanded top 20 through week 12 . toney reclassified into the 2025 class and wasted no time proving he was undervalued as a three-star recruit . he has also shown up against the toughest opponents .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: Your Champions Classic guide: Keys to Kansas-Duke, Michigan State-Kentucky
content: the no. 12 Kentucky Wildcats are set to tip off the 2025 State Farm Champions Classic against the No. 17 Michigan State Spartans . all but one of the 12 games in the past six editions of Champions Classic have been decided by double digits .

title: Yogi Berra's rookie jersey found at Harlem Boys & Girls Club 70 years ago sells for $363K
content: the 1947 new york Yankees jersey sold for $363,505, including buyer's premium . the jersey was photo-matched to the second game of Berra's rookie season . he wore no. 38 and no. 35 during his debut season and 35 in 1947 .

title: Early bets for Week 12: Bears to cover at home, Saints to pull off upset among plays
content: the Buffalo Bills (-4.5) visit the Houston Texans as road favorites on "Thursday Night Football" the late window features a matchup of NFC East rivals when the Dallas Cowboys host the Philadelphia Eagles . the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Los Angeles Rams close out the slate on "sunday night football"

title: Who are the favorites for Tucker? Which teams will go all-in this winter? Passan's MLB offseason preview
content: the largest free agent contract the Pirates have ever handed out was more than a decade ago . the Pittsburgh Pirates were primed to spend more than twice that on Josh Naylor before he re-upped with Seattle for five years and $92.5 million in the first signing .

title: Offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through start of spring training .

title: Ranking the best coaching hires: How Ben Johnson has delivered on expectations
content: a marquee week for benchings is in the books . it's a mark for last-second, winning plays, if you're into that . we'll look at what the biggest storylines mean and what comes next .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Rankings: Oklahoma into top 10
content: Texas still has a path to the College Football Playoff despite three losses . the Aggies left Kyle Field at 10-0 for the first time since 1992 . they have areas to improve as the most important games, including their first appearance since 1992, are ahead .
